snippet: As successive administrations have honored an accord with Iran, the hostages have not given up their efforts in courts and in Congress.
abstract: Retired Air Force Col David M Roeder is among a group of former Iranian hostages who have tirelessly sought compensation from the Iranian government, even as successive administrations honor a 1981 accord that bars them from receiving damages; group has a long-running class-action suit covering more than 100 people that is on appeal to the Supreme Court.
lead_paragraph: As successive administrations have honored an accord with Iran, the hostages have not given up their efforts in courts and in Congress.

headline.seo: Ex-Hostages Keep Pressing for Right to Seek Damages From Iran
headline.main: 3 Decades Later, Ex-Hostages Press On for Damages From Iran
headline.print_headline: 3 Decades Later, Ex-Hostages Press On for Damages From Iran
